faqs.question: What mortgage options are available for property purchase?
faqs.answer: Spanish banks typically offer mortgages covering 70-80% of property value at 2.5-4.5% interest rates (rates vary with market conditions). Non-residents can access financing through Spanish institutions, though some require higher down payments (30% minimum). EU citizens enjoy favorable lending terms. Mortgage brokers specializing in property sales facilitate application processes and documentation.

faqs.question: How are property taxes calculated in Spain?
faqs.answer: De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing (IBI) average 0.4-0.6% of property value in Orihuela Costa, approximately €2,000-3,000 annually for this property. Rental income is taxable at progressive Spanish rates (19-45%), though property expenses (maintenance, management fees, utilities) reduce taxable amounts. Non-resident owners should engage Spanish tax specialists to optimize reporting and compliance.

faqs.question: What is the property management situation for holiday rentals?
faqs.answer: Multiple professional property management companies operate throughout Orihuela Costa, offering turnkey services including guest communication, cleaning, maintenance, and accounting. Management fees typically range 20-30% of rental income, justified by operational efficiency. Alternative self-management requires on-site presence or trusted local agents, reducing management expenses but increasing personal involvement.

faqs.question: Are there capital gains when selling the property?
faqs.answer: Capital gains taxes apply when selling at profit. Non-resident owners pay 19% capital gains tax on appreciation. Resident owners pay progressive rates (19-45%) with personal allowances. Holding properties 3+ years can provide tax efficiencies in some circumstances. Professional tax advisors should guide selling strategies to minimize tax exposure while ensuring compliance.
